Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Copula \Cop"u*la\, n. [L., bond, band. See {Couple}.] 1. (Logic & Gram.) The word which unites the subject and predicate. [1913 Webster]
2. (Mus.) The stop which connects the manuals, or the manuals with the pedals; -- called also {coupler}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Coupler \Coup"ler\ (k?p"l?r), n. One who couples; that which couples, as a link, ring, or shackle, to connect cars. [1913 Webster]
{Coupler of an organ}, a contrivance by which any two or more of the ranks of keys, or keys and pedals, are connected so as to act together when the organ is played. [1913 Webster]
coupler n : a mechanical device that serves to connect the ends of adjacent objects [syn: {coupling}]
